verses.verse: Moreover, the word<WH1697> of the Lord<WH3068> came<WH1961> to me saying,<WH559>
"And you, son<WH1121> of man,<WH120> take<WH5375> up a lamentation<WH7015> over<WH5921> Tyre;<WH6865>

and say<WH559> to Tyre,<WH6865> who dwells<WH3427> at the entrance<WH3996> to the sea,<WH3220> merchant<WH7402> of the peoples<WH5971> to many<WH7227> coastlands,<WH339>' Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> the Lord<WH136> God,<WH3068> "O Tyre,<WH6865> you have said,<WH559> 'I am perfect<WH3632> in beauty.<WH3308>'
"Your borders<WH1366> are in the heart<WH3820> of the seas;<WH3220> Your builders<WH1129> have perfected<WH3634> your beauty.<WH3308>

"They have made<WH1129> all<WH3605> [your] planks<WH3871> of fir<WH1265> trees<WH1265> from Senir;<WH8149> They have taken<WH3947> a cedar<WH730> from Lebanon<WH3844> to make<WH6213> a mast<WH8650> for you.

"Of oaks<WH437> from Bashan<WH1316> they have made<WH6213> your oars;<WH9295> With ivory<WH8127> they have inlaid<WH6213> your deck<WH7175> of boxwood<WH839> from the coastlands<WH339> of Cyprus.<WH3794>

"Your sail<WH4666> was of fine<WH8336> embroidered<WH7553> linen<WH8336> from Egypt<WH4714> So that it became<WH1961> your distinguishing<WH5251> mark;<WH5251> Your awning<WH4374> was blue<WH8504> and purple<WH713> from the coastlands<WH339> of Elishah.<WH473>
"The inhabitants<WH3427> of Sidon<WH6721> and Arvad<WH719> were your rowers;<WH9588> Your wise<WH2450> men,<WH2450> O Tyre,<WH6865> were aboard; they were your pilots.<WH2259>

"The elders<WH2205> of Gebal<WH1380> and her wise<WH2450> men<WH2450> were with you repairing<WH2388> your seams;<WH919> All<WH3605> the ships<WH591> of the sea<WH3220> and their sailors<WH4419> were with you in order to deal<WH6148> in your merchandise.<WH4627>

"Persia<WH6539> and Lud<WH3865> and Put<WH6316> were in your army,<WH2428> your men<WH376> of war.<WH4421> They hung<WH8518> shield<WH4043> and helmet<WH3553> in you; they set<WH5414> forth your splendor.<WH1926>

"The sons<WH1121> of Arvad<WH719> and your army<WH2428> were on your walls,<WH2346> [all] around,<WH5439> and the Gammadim<WH1575> were in your towers.<WH4026> They hung<WH8518> their shields<WH7982> on your walls,<WH2346> [all] around;<WH5439> they perfected<WH3634> your beauty.<WH3308>

"Tarshish<WH8659> was your customer<WH5503> because<WH4480> of the abundance<WH7230> of all<WH3605> [kinds] of wealth;<WH1952> with silver,<WH3701> iron,<WH1270> tin,<WH913> and lead,<WH5777> they paid<WH5414> for your wares.<WH5801>

"Javan,<WH3120> Tubal,<WH8422> and Meshech,<WH4902> they were your traders;<WH7402> with the lives<WH5315> of men<WH120> and vessels<WH3627> of bronze<WH5178> they paid<WH5414> for your merchandise.<WH4627>
"Those from Beth-togarmah gave<WH5414> horses<WH5483> and war<WH9463> horses<WH9463> and mules<WH6505> for your wares.<WH5801>

"The sons<WH1121> of Dedan<WH1719> were your traders.<WH7402> Many<WH7227> coastlands<WH339> were your market;<WH5506> ivory<WH8127> tusks<WH7161> and ebony<WH1894> they brought<WH7725> as your payment.<WH814>

"Aram<WH758> was your customer<WH5503> because<WH4480> of the abundance<WH7230> of your goods;<WH4639> they paid<WH5414> for your wares<WH5801> with emeralds,<WH5306> purple,<WH713> embroidered<WH7553> work,<WH7553> fine<WH948> linen,<WH948> coral,<WH7215> and rubies.<WH3539>

"Judah<WH3063> and the land<WH776> of Israel,<WH3478> they were your traders;<WH7402> with the wheat<WH2406> of Minnith,<WH4511> cakes,<WH6436> honey,<WH1706> oil,<WH8081> and balm<WH6875> they paid<WH5414> for your merchandise.<WH4627>

"Damascus<WH1834> was your customer<WH5503> because of the abundance<WH7230> of your goods,<WH4639> because<WH4480> of the abundance<WH7230> of all<WH3605> [kinds] of wealth,<WH1952> because of the wine<WH3196> of Helbon<WH2463> and white<WH6713> wool.<WH6785>

"Vedan<WH2051> and Javan<WH3120> paid<WH5414> for your wares<WH5801> from Uzal;<WH187> wrought<WH6219> iron,<WH1270> cassia,<WH6916> and sweet<WH7070> cane<WH7070> were among your merchandise.<WH4627>
"Dedan<WH1719> traded<WH7402> with you in saddlecloths<WH2667> <WH899> for riding.<WH7396>
"Arabia<WH6152> and all<WH3605> the princes<WH5387> of Kedar,<WH6938> they were your customers<WH5503> for lambs,<WH3733> rams,<WH352> and goats;<WH6260> for these they were your customers.<WH5503>

"The traders<WH7402> of Sheba<WH7614> and Raamah,<WH7484> they traded<WH7402> with you; they paid<WH5414> for your wares<WH5801> with the best<WH7218> of all<WH3605> [kinds] of spices,<WH1314> and with all<WH3605> [kinds] of precious<WH3368> stones,<WH68> and gold.<WH2091>
"Haran,<WH2771> Canneh,<WH3656> Eden,<WH5729> the traders<WH7402> of Sheba,<WH7614> Asshur,<WH804> [and] Chilmad<WH3638> traded<WH7402> with you.

"They traded<WH7402> with you in choice<WH4360> garments,<WH4360> in clothes<WH1545> of blue<WH8504> and embroidered<WH7553> work,<WH7553> and in carpets<WH1595> of many<WH1264> colors,<WH1264> [and] tightly<WH9029> wound<WH2280> cords,<WH9112> [which were] among your merchandise.<WH4819>

"The ships<WH591> of Tarshish<WH8659> were the carriers<WH7788> for your merchandise.<WH4627> And you were filled<WH4390> and were very<WH3966> glorious<WH3513> In the heart<WH3820> of the seas.<WH3220>
"Your rowers<WH9588> have brought<WH935> you Into great<WH7227> waters;<WH4325> The east<WH6921> wind<WH7307> has broken<WH7665> you In the heart<WH3820> of the seas.<WH3220>

"Your wealth,<WH1952> your wares,<WH5801> your merchandise,<WH4627> Your sailors,<WH4419> and your pilots,<WH2259> Your repairers<WH2388> of seams,<WH919> your dealers<WH6148> in merchandise,<WH4627> And all<WH3605> your men<WH376> of war<WH4421> who<WH834> are in you, With all<WH3605> your company<WH6951> that is in your midst,<WH8432> Will fall<WH5307> into the heart<WH3820> of the seas<WH3220> On the day<WH3117> of your overthrow.<WH4658>
"At the sound<WH6963> of the cry<WH2201> of your pilots<WH2259> The pasture<WH4054> lands<WH4054> will shake.<WH7493>

"And all<WH3605> who handle<WH8610> the oar,<WH4880> The sailors,<WH4419> [and] all<WH3605> the pilots<WH2259> of the sea<WH3220> Will come<WH3381> down<WH3381> from their ships;<WH591> They will stand<WH5975> on the land,<WH776>

And they will make<WH8085> their voice<WH6963> heard<WH8085> over<WH5921> you And will cry<WH2199> bitterly.<WH4751> They will cast<WH5927> dust<WH6083> on their heads,<WH7218> They will wallow<WH6428> in ashes.<WH665>

"Also they will make<WH7139> themselves bald<WH7139> <WH7144> for you And gird<WH2296> themselves with sackcloth;<WH8242> And they will weep<WH1058> for you in bitterness<WH4751> of soul<WH5315> With bitter<WH4751> mourning.<WH4553>

"Moreover, in their wailing<WH5092> they will take<WH5375> up a lamentation<WH7015> for you And lament<WH6969> over<WH5921> you: 'Who<WH4310> is like Tyre,<WH6865> Like her who<WH1822> is silent<WH1822> in the midst<WH8432> of the sea<WH3220>?

'When your wares<WH5801> went<WH3318> out from the seas,<WH3220> You satisfied<WH7646> many<WH7227> peoples;<WH5971> With the abundance<WH7230> of your wealth<WH1952> and your merchandise<WH4627> You enriched<WH6238> the kings<WH4428> of earth.<WH776>

'Now<WH6256> that you are broken<WH7665> by the seas<WH3220> In the depths<WH4615> of the waters,<WH4325> Your merchandise<WH4627> and all<WH3605> your company<WH6951> Have fallen<WH5307> in the midst<WH8432> of you.

'All<WH3605> the inhabitants<WH3427> of the coastlands<WH339> Are appalled<WH8074> at you, And their kings<WH4428> are horribly<WH9623> afraid;<WH8175> They are troubled<WH7481> in countenance.<WH6440>
'The merchants<WH5503> among the peoples<WH5971> hiss<WH8319> at you; You have become<WH1961> terrified,<WH1091> And you will be no<WH369> more<WH369>.<WH5704> <WH5769>' "'"
